3: Sneaking before the database terminal, Murray connects his primed data weapon to the database.
[Accessing Gestalt Core Database: 3-3-2-2-S-Luden]
[Authority Level Required: (&*T*&Ytby]
The data corruption is already so severe...?
Murray selects a program out of his pocket terminal installed with a temporary code library from the Spear of F.O.S.
Activating the program, he directs it to the gateway that connects to the file database.
[Incoming unknown connection]
Let's hope you aren't prepared for this. Or else it'll be trouble.
Activating breaker override, A-E-V-C-Ω.
*Parameters received*
Asimov came up with this thing on a coffee break... or so President Hassen said.
This better work out...
If it weren't for Commander Nikola, I would prefer not to work with you people.
These are Commander Nikola's direct orders.
It's not like he can kill me for refusing to comply. I don't meddle with what they do, but without me, they certainly can't accomplish their goals.
Unlike you little beetles, I'm not a disposable pawn.
But, since I've said yes to your dirty work, you can expect it to be executed perfectly.
And for this, I've already gotten what I needed to know from Nikola.
If that's the case, what's with the hard talk?
Because, I dislike you curs.
Commandants like the Gray Raven Commandant will be the key to recovering Earth, but you... will be nothing but blades rusting in blood.
Hey, V, you hear that? Someone's calling you a dog again.
So?
Somebody's gotta play the dog, so others can play the human.
Good people, bad people—they all need dogs that don't ask questions.
Which is why, I despise you.
Can we return to the mission? I'm about to lose my patience.
You helping us out or not? Chief, decide already. I suggest you do it quickly.
...I'll give you the coordinates of the invader, but only if you tell me what your plans are.
We're monitoring. And to stop this fella from standing in our way.
We gave a warning at the memorial park. Let's hope this little rat takes a hint.
...Monitoring who?
That does not concern you.
